com.gtnewhorizon.structurelib.alignment.constructable

Interface ISurvivalConstructable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IConstructable

    public interface ISurvivalConstructable
extends IConstructable
    An extension to IConstructable. Tile Entities (or delegates returned by IConstructableProvider.getConstructable() should implement this interface to allow third party tools and StructureLib builtin constructable tools to trigger autoplace in survival mode.

    While not originally planned, a creative player can also use this interface to trigger autoplace by using an IItemSource with every possible items in the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean DISABLE_HACKY_MIGRATION_CODE
      End player might want to disable this hack if it turns out to be too crashy

    • Method Detail

      • survivalConstruct

        @Deprecated
default int survivalConstruct(ItemStack stackSize,
                                          int elementBudget,
                                          IItemSource source,
                                          EntityPlayerMP actor)
        Deprecated. 
        Construct the structure using IStructureElement.survivalPlaceBlock(Object, World, int, int, int, ItemStack, IItemSource, EntityPlayerMP, java.util.function.Consumer) or IStructureDefinition.survivalBuild(Object, ItemStack, String, World, ExtendedFacing, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, IItemSource, EntityPlayerMP, boolean)
        Parameters:
        elementBudget - The server configured element budget. The implementor can choose to tune this up a bit if the structure is too big, but generally should not be a 4 digits number to not overwhelm the server
        Returns:
        -1 if done, otherwise number of elements placed this round

      • survivalConstruct

        default int survivalConstruct(ItemStack stackSize,
                              int elementBudget,
                              ISurvivalBuildEnvironment env)
        Construct the structure using IStructureElement.survivalPlaceBlock(Object, World, int, int, int, ItemStack, AutoPlaceEnvironment) or IStructureDefinition.survivalBuild(Object, ItemStack, String, World, ExtendedFacing, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, ISurvivalBuildEnvironment, boolean)
        Parameters:
        elementBudget - The server configured element budget. The implementor can choose to tune this up a bit if the structure is too big, but generally should not be a 4 digits number to not overwhelm the server
        Returns:
        -1 if done, -2 if not supported (e.g. due to an incompatible change in the API of env, otherwise number of elements placed this round

      • __get_player

        Deprecated. 
        Internal hack. Do not use.
